title: Fabrizio Battaglino 2012 Sergentin  (Roero)
description: Aromas of oak, toast, coconut and dark berry lead the nose and carry over to the bracing palate along with white pepper and oak-driven spice. Firm, extremely astringent tannins give this a bracing finish. Drink after 2018.

title: Eighty Four 2009 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Given four years in 100% new French oak and another year in bottle, this is a blockbuster of a wine. It's huge in every way, from its intensity of coconut, vanilla and milk chocolate to its dense, chalky tannins. It may need time to come around, its sheer weight impressively wrapped in blackberry and blueberry jam.

title: Louis Max 2013 Côte Chalonnaise  (Bourgogne)
description: From Louis Max vineyards in the Côte Chalonnaise, this creamy, almost honeyed wine has a ripe character and full-bodied yellow and crisp pear fruit flavors. It's a cut above a basic white Burgundy with its generous texture and the acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Luigi Voghera 2011  Barbera d'Alba Superiore
description: Mature plum, underbrush, spice and mocha aromas lead the nose while the warm, forward palate offers dried black cherry, blackberry extract, licorice and a hint of nut. Drink soon to capture the remaining freshness and before the fruit dries up entirely.

title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Flor de Maio Branco White (Alentejano)
description: A fresh and fruity wine that has a creamy texture and attractive acidity. It is full of lemon and crisp apple flavors with an intense juicy underlay that needs to calm down, so drink this crisp wine from mid-2016.

title: Mahonia 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: It might be a good idea to decant this to let the burnt-match aromas blow off. They tend to mask the ripe, round, fruit-driven style of the wine. Apart from that initial funk, it's a pleasant, fruity, quaffable white wine.

title: Maison L'Envoyé 2013 Two Messengers Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Soft and ultra-smooth, this is crafted in a drink-now style that holds considerable appeal. Lightly spiced purple fruits are in place, and a hint of a vegetal note is almost invisible. If there is a drawback, it is that the wine has been smoothed out to the point of being almost generic.

title: Revancha 2011 La Primera Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Brushy aromas of field herbs blend with scents of oaky vanilla, plastic and stalky berry fruits. This feels saturated and rubbery. A salty flavor profile holds onto the bouquet's stalky character, while the finishing flavors are peppery and herbal, with a hint of sweet plastic derived from oak.

title: Oso Libre 2012 Carnal Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 43% Grenache, 32% Petite Sirah and 25% Syrah shows dense berry aromas along with cherry muffins and violets on the nose. The palate offers interestingly chalky boysenberries and a hint of cocoa dust, but is overwhelmed by a slight sourness and cooked fruit character.

title: Panther Creek 2013 Fir Crest Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This seems slightly underripe, with tart fruit that has as much apple as berry character. Light hints of cola and earth fade into a lemony finish.

title: Rotta 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The fruit elements of black currant and black plum are cut by rotting roses, wet earth and other dank aromas on this bottling. There is a chalky grip right away on the sip, with the flavors holding to a rocky core. The structure is quite dense and wound up right now, so the wine needs some time to open up.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2012 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and stalky berry aromas are bolstered by bold oak aromas. This feels good and healthy, with spicy oaky flavors that are dry lactic and push the wine's fruit to the background. A woody spicy, minty finish ends this. Drink through 2017.

title: Sidewood 2013 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: Cedar and vanilla notes mark the nose of this wine, which boasts ample weight, modest fruit and a soft, open-knit texture. It's appealing for its oaky charm.

title: Peter Nicolay 2014 Erdener Treppchen Off-Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Notes dusty mineral permeate through this zesty, lime-scented Riesling. A touch of honey and tangerine lends brightness to the off-dry palate. Light-footed and spry, it finishes moderately long with a murmur of tea tannins. Drink now.

title: Testarossa 2013 Cuvee Los Gatos Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Iron, pomegranate and dust aromas show on the nose of this entry-level bottling from the Los Gatos producer. Bright red fruits and solid brown spice show on the palate that proves light, airy and easy as it dances across the tongue with energy.

title: The Rule 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Full bodied and brimming in vanilla and ripe peach, this white also offers big flavors of grass and lime zest, coming down in the middle in terms of acidity. Fermented in stainless steel, it's fresh and fruity, with a creaminess to the finish.

title: Tomero 2013 Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: This smells rubbery, with oaky spice, but airing allows it to expand across a lively palate. Herbal, spicy red-berry flavors are strongest in the midpalate, while peppery flavors, rubbery tannins and scratchiness define the finish.

title: Omero 2013 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Bright gold in color, this has nutty, buttery aromatics that lead to a low-alcohol palate built upon a sturdy base of crisp apples. Skin flavors add complexity and weight to what might otherwise feel a bit too thin.

title: Larrea 2013 Juana Larrea Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Berry aromas are a bit stalky, leathery and roasted. This Malbec is lively on the palate, with energy and good balance. A creamy resiny flavor profile is oaky and a touch hot.

title: Le Ginestre 2011 Sottocastello di Novello  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of toast, oak, menthol and mint lead the nose. The palate shows raw red berry and dried sage alongside grainy tannins that leave a mouth-puckering finish.

title: Lion Ranch 2013 Grenache Blanc (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Clean apple, crisp pear and fresh yellow pluot aromas are lifted even more by stony chalkiness on this wine's nicely balanced nose. The palate is ripe with Japanese pear flesh and Anjou pear skins, yet the edges are bursting with tart lime, kumquat and green apple-skin flavors.

title: Lagarde 2012 Primeras Viñas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Aromas of cedary oak, vanilla and spiced berry fruits are encouraging. In the mouth, however, this old-vines Malbec is jumpy and rubbery, with high acidity. Flavors of stalky red plum taste mildly oxidized and Sherried, while the finish is herbal and tastes burnt. All in all, this just doesn't fully come together.

title: Kenefick Ranch 2012 Caitlin's Select Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)
description: Estate grown, this wine offers a density of blueberry and clove aromatically and in terms of flavor. It also has a tightness of tannin and rustic elements of dried herb and leather. Powerfully concentrated, the floral aromatics are hidden somewhat by the richness of the fruit.

title: Zerran 2014 Garnacha Blanca (Montsant)
description: Green-apple and honeyed aromas are more simple and anonymous than special. This varietal white Grenache has a shearing linear acidic palate that fosters tart flavors of tangerine and lemon peel. A stony drawn finish is crisp and zesty.

title: Terra d'Oro 2013 Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: Medium bodied and firm textured, this has smoke and white pepper aromas, rich tomato and plum flavors, and light herbal accents. It offers moderate tannins and a smooth mouthfeel, with a bit of tannic bite.

title: Terra Silvestre 2013 Red (Tejo)
description: The wine is structured, flavored with the wood aging as much as the fruit. It has a spicy burnt character that contrasts with the more juicy black currant flavors. Drink from 2017.

title: Terras de Alter 2013 Terra d'Alter Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)
description: Normally found in the Dão region further north, the Alfrocheiro in Alentejo produces a soft wine with light tannins and juicy acidity. Flavors of cherries and red plums give it a fruity aspect. It is warm, rich and ready to drink.

title: Collina San Ponzio 2011  Barolo
description: This slowly reveals aromas of pressed rose, star anise, ripe berry and a menthol note. On the firm, straightforward palate, hints of licorice and clove add interest to dried black cherry. Give the bracing tannins a few more years to unclench and then drink up to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Dalrymple 2012 Bicheno Single Site Pinot Noir (Tasmania)
description: Pie cherry and rhubarb notes make a bright impression on the nose, followed by tart flavors bundled in a mocha-tinged wrapper. The texture is almost syrupy on the midpalate, but turns dry and dusty on the finish. This is a bit disjointed at this stage, so perhaps it will improve with cellaring. Try after 2018.

title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2014 Curiosité de Bourgogne  (Saint-Bris)
description: Why, at the northern limits of Burgundy, there should be a small village producing Sauvignon Blanc is a curiosity, as the name of the wine suggests. This ripe, tropical fruit and crisp green plum-flavored wine is tightly textured and ready to drink.
